meaningMnemonic:
The main <kanji>reason</kanji> behind your <kanji>connection</kanji> to some people is your <vocabulary>lineage</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>history</vocabulary>. Lineage and history tie people (especially families) together.

This word can be used for people with a prestigious family lineage as well as for historic buildings, especially temples and shrines.
readingMnemonic:
You didn't learn this reading for 由 with the kanji, so here's a mnemonic to help you:

If you had good <vocabulary>lineage</vocabulary> you'd never make a <reading>U-ey</reading> (ゆい) on the highway. That's dangerous, and people with good lineage and a long history would simply never do such a thing.
